entry.title: Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011) (4)20130825
Today I played for about two hours and did the first boss fight. I
feel like the story is a lot weaker than Graces, where you really
felt pushed to the next place right from the beginning. I feel
like the game hasn't even started yet in terms of story, even
though it's seven hours in.

It's crazy that Lightning's voice actress is an enemy!

Total time: 6:44

entry.title: Movie: Iron Man 3, starring Robert Downey, Jr. (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Iron Man 3, starring Robert Downey, Jr. (2013)20130825
This was a very fun movie that did a great job of taking the
character and moving him in a new direction. I really like the way
they gave him more human traits, such as fear. I thought the plot
of the bad guy was very cool. The references to the Avengers was
awesome too. Gwyneth was amazing as usual too. Some of the moments
were a bit absurd, such as the huge army of extra suits that were
disposable.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (3)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651) (3)20130825
Chapter 2 has some interesting moments.

He first explains inertia in a very tortured way, but one that
surprised me given that I had assumed that Newton was the first to
explain it in this way. I'm sure a more studious person would find
a flaw in Hobbes' version, but it seemed on point to me.

Next, he was explaining why memories and experiences fade despite
having made an impression on our senses. His explanation is
basically that we are overwhelmed by other experiences in analogy
to the stars being overwhelmed by the Sun:

"The decay of Sense in men waking, is not the decay of the motion
made in sense; but an obscuring of it, in such manner, as the light
of the Sun obscureth the light of the Starres; which starrs do no
less exercise their vertue by which they are visible, in the day,
than in the night. But because amongst many stroaks, which our
eyes, eares, and other organs receive from externall bodies, the
predominant onely is sensible; therefore the light of the Sun being
predominant, we are not affected with the action of the starrs."

Later, he has this choice line about witches:

"For as for Witches, I think not that their witchcraft is any reall
power; but yet that they are justly punished, for the false beliefe
they have, that they can do such mischiefe, joyned with their
purpose to do it if they can"
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (15)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (15)20130824
I did two missions this morning in about twenty minutes. I did the
News boss fight really really fast and just needed to hit the
glyphs once for each form because I used Devil Trigger mode and
some fast combos. I was really annoyed by the way the camera moves
while you're in the air doing the platforming before the boss
fight. It made me fall to my death three times. :(

entry.title: Movie: Star Trek XII: Into Darkness, starring Chris Pine (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Star Trek XII: Into Darkness, starring Chris Pine (2013)20130823
This was a really fun movie. I think my favourite aspect was the
way it revises and reinterprets situations from the earlier Star
Trek movies. I was a bit disappointed by the lack of any real
interaction with the Klingons or the other races of the Star Trek
universe, even though there are many cameos. But this is a very
minor complaint.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651)
entry.content:
Book: Leviathan, by Thomas Hobbes (1651)20130822
I read the introductory chapter of this edition, from Yale, by the
editor. It was a nice introduction to put in perspective. I was
inspired by the discussion of Hobbes' belief in "creationism",
which for him meant that we can have true knowledge of things that
we create, because we understand all their constituents, but not
the natural world, because we did not create it. This is an
argument I make often about computer science & math versus physics.
  • Books
  • 1651

entry.title: Game: Mega Man: The Wily Wars (GEN, 1994) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man: The Wily Wars (GEN, 1994) (2)20130821
I played the rest of Cut Man's stage. I was extremely disappointed
by the music and I found a lot of the game-play to be poorly
translated. It felt like the hit boxes were wrong, things were a
little sluggish, and the resolution was different (to the point of
the size of things on screen seeming to be the wrong size.)
Overall, it was a big disappointment.

I wish this were more awesome, like how great Super Mario
All-Stars is on the SNES, but it was not to be.

Total time: 0:17
  • Video Games
  • Mega Man: The Wily Wars
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Xillia (PS3, 2011)20130821
I played tonight for about three hours. It is pretty awesome. The
character dynamics are already fun after the first few scenes. The
battle system is really neat and actually a bit different than
Graces, but still clearly within the same framework. I had a bit
of a rough time at first, but once I realized that no one would
heal unless I did as Jude, then I rearranged the Strategy and
started taking control. It is still a bit frantic in fights, which
I enjoy. I'm excited to unlock higher difficulty levels though,
presuming you can do so.

I find the character progression system to be really
overwhelming. I can't tell if I should just do it auto-pilot or
meticulously look at every option and choose the just right ones.

I found Milla's voice actress to be either a weirdo or overdoing
it with the lisp.

Total time: 3:01
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Xillia
  • PS3
  • 2011

entry.content:

entry.title: Game: Beyond Oasis (GEN, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Beyond Oasis (GEN, 1994)20130820
I played through the first dungeon of this game. It was pretty
weird. It is like a beat-em-up RPG. The movement and fighting is
super slow and doesn't have the finesse of a lot of action
RPGs. The graphics are beautiful, but the perspective is a little
confusing. The music is fine and the sound effects are straight
from Streets of Rage. The first dungeon was pretty boring and
overall the whole game was very bleh for me.

Total time: 0:18
  • Video Games
  • Beyond Oasis
  • GEN
  • 1994
